Reviews.Content: Highly recommended! We had a wonderful stay at Cuitat del Prat. Totally recommend it! Our room was beautiful and well serviced, and the reception staff were very helpful and spoke good English.It's a 10 minute walk to the nearest metro station (La Prat del Llobregat - reception can give you a map) and then a 13 minute train trip into Barcelona's central station (Sants). You can buy a T-10 metro ticket for 7.20 EUR, which gives you 10 metro trips and can be used for multiple people (just pass it back after you swipe it).We thought it was quite handy to the city centre and did not experience any of the negative things some have mentioned below. This is a very nice place to stay!
Reviews.Author: 7anna1

Reviews.Content: Great airport hotel. We stayed at this hotel the night of Oct. 31st because we had an early morning flight the next day. Room was clean  comfy; hotel staff was courteous and very helpful and, best of all, there was a complimentary shuttle to the airport.All in all, a good experience if you want to be close to the airport for an early morning flight. Would definitely stay there again.
Reviews.Author: BarbaraLorraine

Reviews.Content: ideal as an airport hotel First to clear up any misunderstandings; this is the same hotel as the Salles Ciutat de Prat.Having stayed at all the Barcelona Airport hotels - none of which is actually at the airport itself - this is the best of the small bunch.It does not have a corporate air, it's food is excellent (both buffet breakfast and high quality dinner), the rooms are comfortable and it has its own shuttle service to the airport, less than 10 minutes away.It has its own car park, where rates are on a par with parking at the airport itself, i.e. quite expensive,it is not really a suitable base for a tourist visit to Barcelona, being too far away from the city, (although easily reachable by train and bus), and it is situated in a not particularly attractive town.But for a pre-flight or post-flight stop, the Ciutat del Prat is ideal.
Reviews.Author: Ritter-Writer

Reviews.Content: Rooms were good...but the service totally sucked Rooms were clean and convenient...But the receptionist was extremely rude and crass..If you like neat rooms and dont mind a scornful welcome when you land ....then this is the place to be!
Reviews.Author: rhdyhun

Reviews.Content: Avoid at all costs Probably the worst 4* hotel we have had the misfortune to stay in!! Restaurant was closed on Saturday night, staff on the whole not helpful and one at least very rude. The rooms were disgusting. Our complaints were completely ignored. Just don't go. You would have to be a prat to stay here!!
Reviews.Author: King_Leonidas_300

Reviews.Content: Good hotel near airport Nice clean comfortable room. If you want to park you will need to get directions from reception to underground car park (15 euros per night). Don't think I would want to stay here if we had been visiting Barcelona as it is a bit far out, but was ideal for overnight stop. Would stay here again.
Reviews.Author: skybelle

Reviews.Content: Good hotel next to the airport       Room
Reviews.Author: DrorW

Reviews.Content: A great airport hotel and base for the city centre "BEWARE BEING RIPPED OFF" We stayed at this hotel from 1st to 5th june 08 expecting a twin room and got a king!! bonus, on arrival we asked a male receptionist about a bus to the city centre, he said there was`nt one, but he could call a taxi for 20 -25 euros! bit suspect we thought, but we had already read that there were busses, so we went out and asked around sure enough you can get one not far from the hotel and at 1.30 euro`s p.p very cheap, its a 165 el prat express which runs regularly you come out of the hotel turn right and walk towards the supermarket a little walk away just on the roundabout there is a bus stop, on the opposite side of the road to the hotel, I have since read that you can also turn left ouside the hotel and catch a number 21 bus, but either way no probs getting into the city cheaply and at approx 15-20 minutes drive quickly enough. BEWARE OF LA RAMBLA the center`s main attraction ( well one of them )eating and drinkling is a rip off, and we would never do it again, but the experience and sights are worth a walk down it, eg. 2 drinks in La Rambla 24 euro`s, same 2 drinks with 2 waters as well off La rambla 4-6 euros, they also charged the next table 27 euros for 2 glasses of sangria!!! We have read a few reviews about the location of the hotel and there not being any bars and shops but we found that not to be the case at all, it was fine, and there was a big square not far from the hotel with bars to eat at and shops, the only problem not far from the hotel an underground parking area was under construction so it was to noisy to use the bars just up from the hotel would definitely do it again a great base, THERE IS A TOURIST PLACE WHERE YOU GET OFF THE BUS GET A STREET MAP, REALLY USEFUL FOR FINDING YOUR WAY ROUND LA RAMBLA.
Reviews.Author: lujakiol

Reviews.Content: Good overnight, would stay again This hotel is relatively close to the airport and they do have a free shuttle in the morning that you book the day before. It is however quite far away from the shopping and sites of Barcelona. We walked the 10mins to the train station and were in the action in about 30mins. Rooms were clean, antique furniture was neat. Pool area was enclosed so very quiet and sauna was hot. We left to early to hit the breakfast. For an overnight this was great but if your in Barcelona for more than a day or so, you would probably want accomodations closer to the tourist areas.
Reviews.Author: Oilfan4life

Reviews.Content: More than we had expected This hotel offered everything that we needed during our stay. The room was large and comfortable although I'm not one for fake flowers which were part of the decor. The sheets were of a high standard, the air conditioning worked well, the bed was comfortable (we did ask for extra pillows), every corner was clean, and the free mini bar was convenient. It is located in a residential neighborhood which means plenty of small shops and places in which to eat. The lobby is quite roomy with a bar and there are two computers (with printer) for guests' use for a small fee. The free airport shuttle was a real bonus because the taxi charges in Barcelona are extremely high.
Reviews.Author: DandB123

Reviews.Content: Good outweighs the bad       Bed
Reviews.Author: foadie

Reviews.Content: Good for what we needed Because we are a bi-racial couple, we were hesitant to book this hotel due to a negative review re. the hotel's service to minorities. But we took a chance and were happy we did. The people at the hotel were actually very accomodating and even offered to talk to the pizza-delivery place for us when we ordered dinner by phone. (Neither of us speak Spanish too well.)The location is pretty far from Barcelona proper, so we would recommend this hotel only if you need to stay close to the airport. Also, the shuttle picked us up from the airport much later than we thought it would. We would've given a higher rating if the shuttle service to the hotel was better.
Reviews.Author: HisnHerrs

Reviews.Content: A tired hotel and a very ordinary experience We stayed here for one night in February when we needed to be close to Barcelona airport. We chose it based on it having received the best reviews of the other hotels in the area. However we were rather disappointed. Although built in 2001, and looking modern from the outside, it feels very much older. The style is very 'Seventies Spanish' with old, elaborate furniture and a very dated decor. The bathroom was large but the marble fittings were showing considerable signs of wear. The shower over the bath was only just adequate. The bed was reasonably comfortable but there were only two bolster style pillows for two people and these were very flat. Maybe we could have asked for more but we were already tired and frazzled. The room was adequately clean but the ageing fittings made it look shabby.The area is partly industrial and partly old, grim apartment blocks. I would not want to walk there after dark but then there is nowhere to walk from here anyway. The street was noisy but the double glazing did keep most of it out. The noise and disturbance we experienced came from the people in the rooms around us. It was possible to clearly hear neighbouring televisions, voices and bathrooms in use as well as the usual doors slamming.We didn't try the restaurant and the room service menu doesn't become available until 8pm and then is very limited.The staff seemed friendly enough but the hotel itself is in desperate need of a major overhaul.Although the hotel is close to the airport - a 5-minute drive - taxis from the terminals have a minimum charge of 鈧?5. When you add to this the additional charge for suitcases, the 鈧?.60 fare became 鈧?7. Whilst this is nothing to do with the hotel, for the same fare, you can reach a city centre hotel. For our return trip to the airport we used the hotel courtesy bus, which was obviously better although the schedule seems a bit vague.I wouldn't stay here again. I would pay a few extra Euros and head for a city centre hotel, which adds very little to journey time and practially nothing to the taxi fare.
Reviews.Author: MM2H

Reviews.Content: not as advertised! watch out what you are getting yourself into. The hotel is not near the airport and shuttle is not provided as per advertisement.I am very dissapointed, especially because I paid extra $50.00 for the convinience of location and shuttle availability
Reviews.Author: 1703a

Reviews.Content: good overnighter Ciutat del PratClose to airport. Free shuttle available to and from airport. Came within 15 mins for me but another couple waited 1 hour. Need to call hotel for shuttle (message starts in Spanish with English translation later). Room was clean. Very convenient if you need to get to the airport early the next morning.
Reviews.Author: k00ch

Reviews.Content: Good Choice We chose this hotel as it was near to the airport with a free shuttle as we were picking up a hire car at the airport 2 days later. We used the hotel shuttle bus which arrived in a few minutes. We found this hotel excellent value for money, the rooms were of a good standard and the breakfast more than adequate. We used the train to get to the centre which was a 15mins walk from the hotel. If I had been staying more than 2 nights I would have booked a hotel in the centre to save the train journey back and forwards but the hotel itself I couldn't fault.
Reviews.Author: Sues-travels

Reviews.Content: A surprisingly good hotel I booked this hotel for a three night stay in Barcelona. I was travelling with my husband and another couple. Although I had read reviews that the hotel was not really suitable for a base to visit Barcelona's attractions, the hotel was cheap and we decided to give it a go.We caught the free hotel shuttle outside arrivals without any problems and arrived at the hotel at around 11am. We weren't able to check-in until 1.30pm but we left our luggage in the luggage room and set off outside to look around the local area. It is an industrial area but there are a few shops and bars nearby.We checked into our rooms and we were not disappointed - the decor was pleasant and the bathroom was spacious. The complimentary soft drinks in the minibar and the toiletries packs were a nice touch.We didn't use the swimming pool or sauna but did go to have a look at them - the pool looked quite small (adequate though) but the pool area was very light and airy.The breakfast in the hotel was nice. However we ate in the restaurant one evening and the food was excellent. We chose to eat from the set menu for 26 euros plus tax per person. At first we thought that this was a reasonable price for a three course meal but that price also included your wine, water and coffee - which was excellent value for such a good quality meal!The best bus to catch into the city centre is the no. 21 bus. If you exit the hotel and turn left, the bus stop is approx 40 metres away on the same side of the road as the hotel. The buses run about every 15mins and the journey takes approx 30 mins. This bus takes you to the port area, just around the corner from the bottom of La Ramblas. The cost of the journey is 1.25 euro each way. You can buy a 3, 4 or 5 day ticket but we never found out where to purchase these ( we were unable to purchase them on board the bus).If you haven't visited the city before, it is well worth buying a ticket for the open top tourist bus which takes you to all the main attractions - buy a two day ticket for 23 euros.Although I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel, I probably wouldn't recommend it as a base for tourists visiting the city attractions as even though it was only a 30 min bus ride away, we felt that it was just a bit too much hassle to return to the hotel after visiting the sights to dress up and go back into the city for the evening.
Reviews.Author: mikcol

Reviews.Content: Good airport hotel       my room
Reviews.Author: AdamStolarczyk

Reviews.Content: Cute Boutique Hotel in an Industrial Neighborhood As noted in the title above, this hotel was a pretty nice hotel. I was very surprised and impressed at how beautiful and romantic the room decor was; the bathroom was pretty roomy, modern, and very clean - all marble. Note that this hotel has a free shuttle that picks you up from the airport, but you must CALL the hotel to tell them you're there (unlike other hotels, that run a shuttle every x amount of minutes); they also lag a little on the pickup so expect to wait ~20 minutes longer then they say. We arrived pretty late at night and decided on grabbing a quick bite at the hotel bar and found that it was average food at high prices (even though the price was much better then if we had chosen to dine in the restaurant, which closes at around 11-11:30 pm). As this was the first night in the hotel, we found that it was also convenient that they exchanged our USD to EUROS at a fairly decent exchange rate. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to guests that arrive late to Barcelona on the first day as the shuttle service is very convenient - but that's about it. It is a very good value for the money, and you get to keep all the beverages in the fridge for free!. However, if you plan to use this hotel as your base for discovering Barcelona, be aware that it is in an industrial area with no shops/restaurants to go (really not much to see, overall). It is also a good 15 minute walk to the main train station, which is different from the train that services most of the Barcelona city area (where all the sites are). I wouldn't recommend this hotel to travellers using it as a base, as it might not be safe to walk to/from the train station at night.
Reviews.Author: anonymousBA

Reviews.Content: Fine airport hotel It gets the job done as an airport hotel but that's about it. The free shuttle picked us up at 1am from the airport and drove us back in the morning. The location is creepy but who cares. I wouldn't stay here for any reason but convenience to the airport. If you need to call the shuttle, the hotel phone number is on the hotel shuttle pick up sign outside the airport.
Reviews.Author: DCmember

Reviews.Content: Great Airport Hotel If you need a hotel for an overnight, this is it. The room was clean and big, and the bathroom also was big. It even had disposable toothbrushes, toothpaste, comb, blade and the fridge had a couple of sodas and water for free too. I booked this hotel for the free shuttle and I called them from the airport and they gave me a pickup location (late at night too) and then I booked it for my return to the airport the next day. Both were on time.
Reviews.Author: maltaFlorida

Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel at all cost!!! The physical infruastrucure of the hotel was great i. e room etc but the customer service for ethnic minority client was far from acceptable. The staff was very unhelpful and rude each time we rang or went to the front desk to enquire about anything. Even attemtped to over charge us on check out. The bar was closed when we tried to get stuff to drink and order food. It was very obvious the service we recieved was very different from the caucasian clients at the hotel. We were not even informed or offer the free shuttle to the airport as the others were. I highly recommend all ethnic minorities avoid this hotel.
Reviews.Author: LondonAlicia

Reviews.Content: Great hotel if you want to be near the Airport If you need to be near the Barcelona airport then this is the hotel. Upon our arrival to the airport we called for a free shuttle. It arrived within 15-20 minutes. The pickup point is outside between terminals BC and has a sign listing the hotels serviced. The hotel itself was very clean and quiet and the room was a good size. The fitness room was really small but fit our needs. We skipped breakfast and went down the street. Like another reviewer wrote, turn right outside the door and go down a couple blocks. On the right side is a good bakery with coffee too. Overall, a great deal and the service  staff were excellent.
Reviews.Author: kcinders

Reviews.Content: Fine airport hotel Our family of four stayed just one night en route for the Costa Brava after a late evening arrival at Barcelona airport.The airport shuttle worked just fine and we were not left waiting too long at the airport. The front desk was excellent, making us feel very welcome on arrival and providing very good advice about public transport the following morning. The rooms were very comfortable indeed and the sumptuous marble bathrooms very well equipped. As well as the usual toiletries the hotel also provided a shaving kit, disposable toothbrush and show polish. The minibar was stocked with soft drinks at no extra cost. There were very good business facilities with free wi fi and nice conference rooms. The breakfast was hard to fault-perhaps the only negative was the fact that the orange juice was not the genuine article. The small indoor pool was open very early and it was a welcome change in this day and age to be able to use the pool before breakfast. Okay, the hotel is in an industrial location, but it is primarily an airport hotel and surely meant for short stays. We did not pay an excessive amount for what the hotel offered and felt we had good value for money. We were very impressed indeed and would love to have picked it up and taken it with us further up the coast!
Reviews.Author: Wulfrunian

Reviews.Content: Great Airport Hotel This hotel is a great hotel for the airport. There is a free shuttle which picks you up or drops you off from the airport which is about 5 minutes drive away.The hotel itself was modern and clean, the bed was v comfortable and the bathroom spacious. It is also convenient to get to the centre of Barcelona too from this hotel, you will need to walk 5 minutes and you will get to a train station which you can take to the centre in about 15 minutes. The trains are also quite frequent - every 15 minutes or so and also run until quite late.We didn't try the other facilities they had at the hotel like the gym or pool or jucuzzi unfortunately. I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: kittyphobia

Reviews.Content: VEr nice, right next to airport for quick gettaway   showReview(5790114, 'full');
Reviews.Author: Julay

Reviews.Content: Convenient to airport   showReview(5396201, 'full');
